body:
The contributing guide states to squash all commits into a single commit yourself with message like `[AIRFLOW-XXX] ...`, so you're saying that's not needed?

If so, I could update the contributing guide.
@Fokko @feng-tao , for you notice please.

yes my bad.
I wanted to push a fix but I saw @Fokko  already did:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4421/commits/0834a1033719528773170a5930e214fb3bcaa518

@eladkal No worries!
I will close this PR then given @Fokko already noticed this issue.

I wonder why this didn't get any comments/code review?

Yes, this is still preferred, otherwise, the committers have to do it.
Thanks @XD-DENG @kaxil
@sarmadali20 Please file a Jira issue.
@sarmadali20 Can you open a Jira ticket? This is being used to generate the release logs.
@ashb This one could be a candidate for removal as well
One more rebase?
@Fokko @kaxil can you take a look?

@kaxil This PR affects only old UI.
If this one is a go it needs to be merged for 1.10.2 before the final call :)
@Fokko two more rebase done 😉
Thanks @Fokko!  Looks like the rerun succeeded here as well.

Restarted build, will merge if all tests pass.

All the conn type are defined [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/airflow/models/connection.py#L53-L92) and they are all lower case consistently. We don't use .lower() because these conn types are hard-coded into the connection.py module.

I noticed that in your JIRA it shows `MySQL` instead, perhaps it's a custom created connection type?
@ashb Are you okay with merging this on a short term? Otherwise, we'll end up with merge conflicts again.

This commit breaks for Zipped dags. Since dag_model.fileloc is path_to_zip/dagfile.py

Here is the error I'm getting for any zipped tags:
airflow.exceptions.DagNotFound: Dag id sample not found

I found that Travis build failed due to this:

```
5.6: Pulling from library/mysql
ERROR: error pulling image configuration: unknown blob
```

I believe there was an error when pulling images from Docker hub, and a retry should fix this problem.
How could I trigger a re-build on Travis?

@xianping Please resolve the conflicts and squash the commits. 
Once done it will be ready for code review
@gsakkis note that your code apply changes to the old UI which will be deprecated once https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4339 is merged. It's being replaced with RABC.

@kaxil Is there any instruction to run specific test locally? I want to debug the following error.

```
======================================================================
11) ERROR: test_table_location (tests.contrib.hooks.test_bigquery_hook.TestBigQueryExternalTableSourceFormat)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/contrib/hooks/test_bigquery_hook.py line 205 in test_table_location
      cursor.create_external_table(external_project_dataset_table, schema_fields, source_uris)
    airflow/contrib/hooks/bigquery_hook.py line 499 in create_external_table
      self.service.tables().insert(
   AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'tables'
```

and it is weird the test failed but the job did not fail. 
https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-airflow/jobs/474431499

@yohei1126 Yep
https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#running-unit-tests
@ron819 Thanks!
I fixed most of the changes @kaxil and propose to defer some of the proposed changes to later commit - covering more operators for the same change (project_id optional).

@kaxil -> implemented most of it. I again proposed to make project_id optional as separate change (we have some other operators in spanner to make them optional as well for consitency). Having separate change with only this would be much more efficient for changing and testing (then we can run our automated System tests on all environments at once for all operators after such global change.
@kaxil - fixed and rebased.

> Does the feature work when the log is in a remote location(like some s3 directory)?

Hi @feng-tao , that is a great question. It should work since my changes do not involve any logger handlers.

Good point. I'll rename to `errors.py`.

@mik-laj There's one other error-class in models.py -> InvalidFernetToken. I was thinking of grouping that into a `fernet.py` script since there's a few fernet-related functions and classes in models.py. So for now, `errors.py` will only contain ImportError.
Closing because https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4421.
Closing because https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4421.

Hi @gerardo I did some looking into tests.operators.test_virtualenv_operator.test_string_args  as well. Looking at the Python operator description string args is the only supported method of allowing configuration when the Python versions don't match between airflow and operator -- which would be why it does the test through these string arguments. 

It looks like if we want to make that test workable in CI then the Python 2 image needs Python 3 installed as well and vice versa just different default Pythons configured.

Hello guys,

I am not sure if it's the right place to ask it, but do you think if these upgrades will be included in the next release please ?

Thanks !
PTAL @jgao54 , doc updated.

@jgao54  - Ahhh, you are correct! I add the airflow connections from the command line during setup:
```
airflow connections --add --conn_id test_local_mysql --conn_type "MySQL" ...
```
I was matching the name that was found on the UI. 

After updating the connection add command to use `--conn_type "mysql"`, it now works as expected:
```
>>> from airflow.hooks.base_hook import BaseHook
>>> conn = BaseHook.get_connection('test_local_mysql')
[2019-01-03 14:38:37,639] {base_hook.py:83} INFO - Using connection to: localhost
>>> conn.conn_type
'mysql'
>>> type(conn.get_hook())
<class 'airflow.hooks.mysql_hook.MySqlHook'>
```

Thanks for that! I was wondering why no one else was seeing this issue.
@potiuk Any reason we are not using Rest API (Json) like the other operators and using the python client library?

@kaxil  - yes. Actually the Google Cloud Python Client Library is preferred over the discovery based libraries.  Those Google Cloud Python Libraries are newer, better maintained and new features are being added frequently (plus they are better optimised and implement some features such as waiting for long operations to complete). The discovery based library is really on a deprecation path. 

Actually the only reason why we have not used python idiomatic libraries for the other operators is because those services do not yet have python client library other than the discovery-based one :) 

It's all explained here:

https://cloud.google.com/apis/docs/client-libraries-explained

I know it's confusing as different names are being used so here is the explanation:

* "Google Cloud Client Libraries" - are the new ones (ones used in Spanner and BigTable) 
* "Google API Client Libraries" are the older - discovery based ones.
Definitely, I cherry-picked it for 1.10.2 :)
+1 from my side, we are anyway maintaining the entire codebase. But want to hear thought from other committers as well @jlowin @feng-tao @Fokko @ashb ?
Thanks @potiuk it makes sense to me now :) . We probably have few minor issues in this PR that are unresolved, once it is done, I will merge this one.
@ncrocfer Yes this will be available in the next release :) - 1.10.2
@Fokko Done :)
great! it does look like we are short of an input validation check for CLI that could have made this a bit easier to detect. contributions welcome :)
non k8 test passed, merging.
@tedmiston , any update on this pr? Are you still planning on working on fixing the issue?

> Does the feature work when the log is in a remote location(like some s3 directory)?

Hi @feng-tao I have tested it against the elasticsearch log handler. It works fine.
Absolutely, that is a great idea!
Thanks for your feedback, @feng-tao.  I have addressed them.

@msumit 
It should work the same way. Please see `airflow/www_rbac/static/js/connection_form.js`, I think you could make the same change there.
Thanks for the info @jgao54, will do the changes there as well.

Hmmm... not sure what the goal is here.

If it is to make DAGs more secure , it can (and should) be done via dag-level access control (instead of config-based as this PR suggests), for sake of better security.

If it is to allow filtering DAGs by owner for better navigation on the homepage (which seems like a neat feature), it could potentially be done via a `Hide DAGs not owned by me` toggle, in a similar fashion to `Hide Paused DAGs`.
thanks @pingzh
+1 on @jgao54 , the filtering could be done through DAG-level access if this is what the pr for. Besides this pr has indentation error and print line in the code.

@pingzh @feng-tao sorry for late comment, but won't it be better if we provide download logs feature at the "View Logs" page itself, instead of from the model dialog? As IMO people would anyway want to view logs first and then take the decision of downloading it?

@jgao54 @kaxil plz see if any of you can merge this PR?

PTAL @ashb @kaxil @Fokko @bolkedebruin @mistercrunch @r39132 @jghoman

I believe we need to commit this change by 1/8?

@pingzh totally agree with the problem of large logs, but I think that's a diff problem to solve, and can be solved easily, for example, see this https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3992.

@msumit , I think your point is valid, but sometimes the log file is very hard to render and view if the file is too large(not sure of the status or the implementation detail for #3992). The log file is very critical for debugging production issue on why the task not running. And adding this action provides to task instance UI panel(all the operations for task instance) provides a way to download the file based on different try number. Hence I think this pr provides value on solving this issue.

@msumit Thanks for the info. In my mind, for large log files, `tailing` or `range` lines does not provide lots of insights when trying to find something. And it looks like #3992 only supports file log handler at least for now.

It is also a good idea to add a download btn after users are in the "View Logs" page.
@kaxil , could we add this change including https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4305 to v10.2? Or v10.2 is for minor patch only?
